thread.title: Great Neck's Shea loses in final of state PGA Match Play Championship
thread.title_full: Great Neck's Shea loses in final of state PGA Match Play Championship

author: Day Staff Reports
title: Great Neck's Shea loses in final of state PGA Match Play Championship
text:
Great Neck's Shea loses in final of state PGA Match Play Championship Published October 15. 2015 8:55PM Day Staff Reports 
Kevin Shea played perhaps his best golf of the season to reach the final of the 25th Connecticut Section PGA OMEGA Match Play Championship on Thursday. 
But Shea, the head professional at Great Neck Country Club in Waterford, fell just short, losing to Jordan Gosler of Manchester Country Club, 3&2, Thursday at Goodwin Park Golf Course in Hartford. 
Shea was down two holes at the turn in the well-played match. His birdie on the 13th hole cut the deficit to one. But he never recovered from a double bogey on the next hole. Gosler ended the match with a 10-foot birdie putt on No. 16. 
It was Shea's best finish in the match play championship. Upsets ruled the tournament, as Shea and Gosler reached the final as the No. 7 and No. 6 seeds, respectively. 
Gosler and Shea both qualified to play on the 2016 CT PGA Challenge Cup team. Adam Rainaud of Black Hall Club in Old Lyme also earned a spot.
